oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Panamanian ceramic vessel with applique handles
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian vessel with a rounded base and restricted rim, finished with a red ochre slip. Below the rim, two appliqués project from the shoulder of the vessel at opposing sides, serving as handles, with possible stylistic designs.
Multiple cracks radiate down from lip. Handles are too worn to identify stylistic design. Shows general wear around base
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
